Tiap Hari Ada 319 Janda Baru Di Kota Semarang
01 Nov 2019, 22:25 by Tika Vilystya Budiman



Tiap Hari Ada 319 Janda Baru Di Kota Semarang



Tiap Hari Ada 319 Janda Baru Di Kota Semarang


KBRN, Semarang: Angka perceraian  di Kota Semarang masih cukup tinggi. Bahkan diproyeksikan saat ini telah ada peningkatan jumlah kasus sebesar 5 persen dari tahun sebelumnya.
Menurut data Pengadilan Agama Klas 1A Semarang elama 10 bulan mulai Januari- Oktober terdapat 3193 perkara yang telah diputus. Jika dirata- rata tiap hari terdapat 319 Janda Baru di kota lumpia ini. Dengan rincian 621 untuk cerai talak dan 1937 cerai gugat.
Ketua Pengadilan Agama Klas I A Semarang, Anis Fuad menyebut faktor pemicu tiap tahun sama yakni ekonomi dan pendidikan.
“Dengan pendidikan rendah emosionalnya tinggi dari pada rasionalnya.Perkara yang diajukan rata rata gugat cerai , istrinya yang mengajukan karena ga ada tanggungjawab dari suami ga ada,” katanya.
Panitera Muda Hukum Pengadilan Agama  Kota Semarang, Tazkiyaturrobihah menambahkan faktor pemicu utama perceraian adalah pertengkaran yang dapat disebabkan oleh berbagai hal diantaranya pernikahan dini, pendidikan rendah, ekonomi.
“Kalau faktornya sebenarnya pertengkaran tapi sub-faktornya dia belum siap, ekonomi. Dihadapkan pada persoalan hidup tapi belum mapan pastikan emosi terus bertengkar. Akhnya ga bisa cari jalan keluar jadi pilih bercerai saja. Memang ga semua kasus begitu tapi rata –rata begitu,” tandasnya.
Menurutnya, dari tingginya kasus perceraian di Kota Semarang Pedurungan dan Semarang Barat menyumbang angka terbesar.
“Antara Semarang Barat dan Pedurungan itu berkejar kejaraan tiap bulan. Untuk September itu di Pedurungan ada 52 kasus perceraian sementara Semarang Barat sampai 39 orang,” ungkapnya.
Tazkiya mengatakan  guna melakukan upaya pencegahan, PA Semarang tetap mengutamakan jalur mediasi untuk menekan angka perceraian di kota Semarang. Akan tetapi tak dipungkiri jalur ini menuai jalan buntu dan berujung dengan putusan cerai.

Every Day There Are 319 New Widows in Semarang City
01 Nov 2019, 22:25 by Tika Vilystya Budiman



Every Day There Are 319 New Widows in Semarang City



Every Day There Are 319 New Widows in Semarang City


KBRN, Semarang: The divorce rate in Semarang City is still quite high. It is even projected that there is currently an increase in the number of cases by 5 percent from the previous year.
According to data from the Klas 1A Religious Court Semarang for 10 months from January to October, there were 3193 cases that had been decided. If averaged every day there were 319 New Widows in this lumpia city. With details 621 for divorce divorce and 1937 divorce.
Chairperson of the Class A Religious Court of Semarang, Anis Fuad, said that the triggering factors every year are the same, namely economics and education.
"With low emotional education higher than the rational. The lawsuit filed for divorce on average, his wife who filed because there is no responsibility from the husband does not exist," he said.
The Young Registrar of Law at the Semarang City Religious Court, Tazkiyaturrobihah added that the main triggering factor for divorce is quarrels which can be caused by various things including early marriage, low education, economy.
"If the factor is actually a fight but the sub-factor is he is not ready, the economy. Faced with life problems but not yet established make sure emotions continue to quarrel. Finally can't find a way out so just choose divorce. Indeed, not all cases are like that but on average, "he said.
According to him, from the high divorce cases in the City of Semarang Pedurungan and West Semarang accounted for the largest number.
"Between West Semarang and Pedurungan, the race starts every month. For September there were 52 divorce cases in Pedurungan while West Semarang had 39 people, "he said.
Tazkiya said that in order to make prevention efforts, PA Semarang continued to prioritize mediation channels to reduce the number of divorces in the city of Semarang. However, it is inevitable that this road will lead to a dead end and lead to a divorce decision.
